nothing.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Nothing ever happens in this town.
There was nothing else the doctors could do.
He had nothing more to say.
We know nothing about her family.
I couldn’t just stand by and do nothing.
I promised to say nothing about it to anyone.
We’ve heard nothing from her for weeks.
There’s absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.
‘Do you know much about business?’ ‘Nothing at all.’
She had eaten virtually nothing at supper.
There’s nothing wrong with the data.
A brief search was made but they found nothing untoward.
nothing.translation[0].definitions[1].de: something which is considered unimportant, not interesting, or not worth worrying about
nothing.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: ‘What have you been doing?’ ‘Nothing. Just sitting here.’
‘What did you do last weekend?’ ‘Oh, nothing much.’
Politics meant nothing (=was not important) to me for years.
The meal was nothing special (=it was not unusual or interesting) – just fish with a cheese sauce.
nothing.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: We beat them ten to nothing.
nothing.translation[0].definitions[3].de: no money or payment at all
nothing.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: This service will cost you nothing.
When a car has done that many miles, it’s worth nothing.
nothing.translation[0].note_box[0].items: Don’t use nothing  with another negative word such as ‘not’ Use anything You say
I could not find anything suitable
I could not find nothing suitable
